title: Settings for synchronizing two existing machines.
content: Hi I have used two computers for different purposes and places, but have had the same account with passwords synchronized on both machines. I would like to synchronize everything - especially bookmarks and payment methods - on the machines. My question is: what happens if I 'just' set synchronization active in all sections on both machines? Is one of the machines considered the 'master' machine, so its 'content' is synchronized to the other, so that content that was not on the 'master' machine is deleted? Or is everything preserved, so I have all content from both machines on both machines? Where can I possibly find more detailed information about this? Thanks in advance.
creator: mogensjaeger

title: I'm new to Firefox and I have questions.
content:
I'm new to Firefox (I just started checking it out today). I came from Chrome and I have some questions.


1. Does Firefox have a limit to how much internet history it can hold? I did a full sync from Chrome.

2. Can I delete the folder "Old Firefox Data"?

3. How do we turn off "Thought-provoking Stories"?

4. Will there be an option to upload images to make them the homepage background?
creator: rugratkid2050

title: Hardware acceleration dropping frames on videos with small viewport resolutions
content:
Hi!

I've noticed dropped frames in videos for a while now, but only recently tested the issue. Using youtubes stats for nerds, I found that when videos have a small viewport resolution, it starts to drop frames. (I would test with other sites but only know of youtubes stats for nerds system to detect issues like this) For example a viewport resolution of 1250x703 does not drop frames, however by unmaximising the screen and the viewport resolution drops to 681x383, it begins dropping frames.

Using my 2nd monitor which has a smaller actual resolution, the video drops frames unless fullscreened, see recordings below. Test A | Firefox Maximised but video not fullscreen Test B | Firefox Maximised and video fullscreen This issue also occurs with picture-in-picture mode.

Disabling hardware acceleration fixes this issue but for some reason only affects firefox, using MS Edge with "graphics acceleration" enabled does not result in this issue. Is this potentially an issue specifically with how firefox handles hardware acceleration? Also since I require hardware acceleration to be enabled for 3D model work in my browser, is there something I'm missing here that would allow me to keep hardware acceleration on but not have this issue?

Any help is much appreciated, thanks!
creator: nathantudor72

title: Disable all Hot-keys (keyboard "shortcuts")

title: Is there a *hit-simple TBird yet?
content:
If I send mail to curly@stooges.com, it gets put in the curly@stooges.com mailbox -- created if it doesn't exist.

If I get an email from curly@stooges.com, it gets put in the curly@stooges.com mailbox -- created if it doesn't exist. If I reply, the reply gets put in the curly@stooges.com mailbox.

I have one and only one SMTP account. I have 1,000,001 POP accounts. Mailboxes and accounts have no relationship.

This is a serious question, not a joke.

Thanks -- Mark (frozen at version 102.7.1 until a *hit-simple TBird exists).
creator: markfilipak
